title: Curly Old School Font (could be hand drawn)
content:
Hello,

I've tried to identify this font by going to whatthefont and identifont and have had no luck. I've also perused dafont for about an hour. Any help would be super appreciated!

I realize the words on the left and right of "Growly" are made up of a simple serif font. It's the word "Growly" in the middle that i'm needing to identify.

Thanks so much,

Kelsey

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140830045120im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Growly_6106.JPG)
author: KTodd

comments.content: The word 'GROWLY' is in the swash capital form of the simple serif font that you seem uninterested in and I'm unable to identify. So they're the same font, basically.

Looks like the swashes and alternates for [Bookmania](http://web.archive.org/web/20140830045120/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/bookmania/)

The lower case text looks to be Bookmania as well, or Bookman of sorts.
